thread.title: Utah notebook: Utes pleased with quality of Tuesday's practice
thread.title_full: Utah notebook: Utes pleased with quality of Tuesday's practice | Deseret News

author: Dirk Facer
title: Utah notebook: Utes pleased with quality of Tuesday's practice
text:
Fifth-ranked Utah’s second practice of the week surpassed the first as Saturday’s homecoming game with No. 23 California approaches.
Upcoming Games Utah 39 Mins 0 Secs More Coverage Want drama? Storylines galore? Look at college QBs in state of Utah Utah notebook: Fake punt return catching on elsewhere Utes back in the college football spotlight Utes' special teams earn praise from Pac-12 coaches Utah notebook: Utes break in new turf at Rice-Eccles Stadium Utah Utes video: Players happy with new turf at Rice-Eccles Stadium “ We had a good day of practice today and were excited for this opportunity.”
Utah quarterback Travis Wilson
SALT LAKE CITY — Fifth-ranked Utah’s second practice of the week surpassed the first as Saturday’s homecoming game with No. 23 California approaches.
“It was good, much better than yesterday. Yesterday was so-so and that’s to be expected coming off a break,” Utah coach Kyle Whittingham said of the practices. “Today was a 180-degree turnaround from yesterday — not that yesterday was horrible, but today was very good.”
Starting quarterback Travis Wilson also noted that things are going well.
“We had a good day of practice today and we’re excited for this opportunity,” he said, adding that the Utes have got to keep on preparing this week.
Wilson, though, is confident they’ll be ready to go. He noted that the bye week has helped out.
“It definitely helped out in my situation. I got to heal up a little bit and recover a little bit, got my arm back a little bit, too,” Wilson said. “So I think all in all it definitely helped this team. It’s definitely to our advantage for this week.”
MINER MENTALITY: Beginning with Saturday’s game against Cal, the Utes embark on a season-ending schedule that includes eight consecutive Pac-12 contests without another bye week.
“We’re about to go down in the Pac-12 cave and we’ll surface in eight weeks and see where we are,” Whittingham said.
EXTRA POINTS: The Utes have given up just one sack this season, fewest in the Pac-12. ... Utah’s home game against Arizona State on Oct. 17 will kick off at 8 p.m. MDT. It’ll be broadcast on ESPN or ESPN2. ... A homecoming pep rally is set for Friday (noon) at City Creek Center. ... Recent recruiting commitments include defensive end Leki Fotu (Herriman HS), wide receiver R.J. Hubert (Moapa Valley HS, Nevada), linebacker Alema Pilimai (Tustin HS, California) and defensive lineman Semisi Lauaki (Leuzinger HS, California).
